thread.title: Homes evacuated as bomb squad clears rusty grenade from gutter at Wellington suburb
thread.title_full: Homes evacuated as bomb squad clears rusty grenade from gutter at Wellington suburb

author: Jared Nicoll
title: Homes evacuated as bomb squad clears rusty grenade from gutter at Wellington suburb

organizations.name: new zealand defence force explosive ordinance disposal team

text:
Homes evacuated as bomb squad clears rusty grenade from gutter at Wellington suburb JARED NICOLL Last updated 19:03, February 21 2017 JENNIFER HEATH 
Police cordoned off part of Victory Ave in Karori after an old grenade was spotted in a gutter at about 5.20pm on February 21. 
Homes in the Wellington suburb of Karori were evacuated while a bomb squad cleared a rusty grenade from a gutter on Tuesday evening. 
A police cordon blocked the street and some homes along Victory Ave in Karori were evacuated while members of the New Zealand Defence Force Explosive Ordinance Disposal Team cleared away an old inactive grenade at about 5.30pm. 
A police spokesman said a member of the public spotted the grenade in a gutter. 
"Cordons were put in place and some neighbours' houses were evacuated." 
The scene was wrapped up about an hour later.
